Class BaseDatabaseCollectionReader

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LeoCollectionReaderInterface, org.apache.uima.collection.base_cpm.BaseCollectionReader, org.apache.uima.collection.CollectionReader, org.apache.uima.resource.ConfigurableResource, org.apache.uima.resource.Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatabaseCollectionReader

    public abstract class BaseDatabaseCollectionReader
extends BaseLeoCollectionReader
    Retrieves rows from a database and returns them one at a time for extending readers to handle. Assumes there is one record per row of results. User: Thomas Ginter Date: 7/11/14 Time: 15:00

      • getProgress

        public abstract org.apache.uima.util.Progress[] getProgress()
        Gets information about the number of entities and/or amount of data that has been read from this CollectionReader, and the total amount that remains (if that information is available).

        This method returns an array of Progress objects so that results can be reported using different units. For example, the CollectionReader could report progress in terms of the number of documents that have been read and also in terms of the number of bytes that have been read. In many cases, it will be sufficient to return just one Progress object.

        Returns:
        an array of Progress objects. Each object may have different units (for example number of entities or bytes).

      • getData

        protected void getData(String query)
                throws SQLException,
                       ClassNotFoundException
        Executes the query and saves the results internally to a List of Object[] to be retrieved when getNext() is called.
        Parameters:
        query - the sql query to run.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if the driver cannot be found
        SQLException - if there is an error executing the query

      • removeUnneededColumns

        protected static ArrayList<String> removeUnneededColumns(ArrayList<String> rows,
                                      int... skipColumns)
        Sets columns to "".
        Parameters:
        rows - The rows to process.
        skipColumns - The columns in each row to set to "". Zero based.
        Returns:
        the rows with specified columns set to "".
